name: socks
text: Strips like this one are the reason I started frequenting this website.

name: professorriffs
text: The footage of Ray making the muffins dance is a good thing to have.

name: joebot
text: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xoKbDNY0Zwg

name: fmercury
text: I'm sure he was a great guy, but the poor bastard looks like Freddie Mercury and Hitler had a baby.

name: tekende
text: The love that society and time would not allow.

name: kyrasmash
text: Freddie all tender, holding Hitler after a long hard Night of Long Knives. Hitler making cookies for Freddie's Farsi friends and neighbors. Just domestic as hell.

name: thesoulbear
text: I was killed in Kristallnacht. Not cool, not funny, not a good comment.

name: st-elmos_fire
text: recognise anyone?

name: snatch22
text: I actually saw the movie that panel was based on.  It was the best part of that movie, and damn near the best here.

name: layzerblade
text: There's no "actually" about it. Anyone who hasn't seen The Gold Rush has had a deficient education.

name: morbo
text:
The saddest thing is when charlie chaplin does a wonderful thing with his dinner rolls, but it was all a dream and he's actually by himself in alaska on new year's eve and the woman he loves has stood him up.

that movie was so heartbreaking, i don't care what happens in the last five minutes.

name: senseihollywood
text: Charlie Chaplin in "The Tramp", no?

name: snatch22
text: Very good, yeah.  Well, actually, the movie is called "The Gold Rush", but he plays the tramp in it.

name: senseihollywood
text: ah...well that sounds right...I award u a chubby for your efforts...btw this is one of the best tricks for entertaining bored children at wedding receptions, wakes, etc...

name: joeyramoney
text: almost. you almost got it right.

name: ferdinand
text: johnny depp does it in "benny and Joon," too.

name: choosebro
text: As long as we are mentioning things that happened, Grandpa also did it in The Simpsons.

name: vandenbos
text: Yeah, and he got mad shut-down for it, too.

name: tim_simmons
text: also happens in black books and bernard shuts down manny well harsh

name: madnes
text: Also Robert Downey Jr did it in some movie called "Chaplin" but I don't think he was referencing anything, it was just a weird coincidence.

name: tekende
text: Also a cousin of mine did it one time at dinner, this was like twelve years ago, I wouldn't expect any of you all to know about it

name: boredom_man
text: Also when I was in high school at lunch I'd say "Psst... you're eating footwear" to people and even the few who got it didn't care.

name: choosebro
text: Was this only at lunches that involved Potatoes or Muffins or just with any old type of food?

name: boredom_man
text:
Please pick the response that you prefer:

1. No potatoes. "Psst... you're eating footwear," is from a different scene in "The Gold Rush," in which Chaplin eats a shoe.

2. I was unable to distinguish Potatoes and Muffins from Other Foods at my high school luncheons.

name: selbencoirlo
text: In a high school cafeteria I'd say the odds are pretty good that you WERE eating footwear, or something that had once been worn on feet, anyway.

name: tombsgrave
text: Old-tymey slang is the best slang of all.

name: epicurus
text:
Little nephew is probably my favourite character that I should probably not like at all. (runner-up: Pat)
I always enjoy the dialogue between Ray and Little Nephew.

name: spinynorman
text: Agreed. This strip is just downright fucking delightful due to this flustered exchange.

name: dougthehead
text: Man, there are people in the world who think the "dancing rolls" thing originated with Benny & Joon?  I just became sad and scared.  Know your heritage, people!

name: madnes
text: I heard that Robert Downey Jr improv'ed the dancing rolls on the set of "Chaplin" and it was so funny the producers actually travelled back in time to...well, I've said too much.

name: ferdinand
text: A comment left by ferdinand was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by divot, mikekitchell, mashisoyo, SchnappM, instantkarma, chivalress, FancyRat, thesyndicate88, coffeecoaster, mistlethrush, Wulvaine, stormagnet)

name: rowboat
text: I think he was referring to the alt text. Your combative defensiveness is unbecoming.

name: stuart
text: Stealth Simpsons references incoming

name: fermatprime
text: Robert Downey Jr, though, actually believed they were dancing feet .

name: chrissketch
text: Huh, I always figured it was a Buster Keaton thing because of Benny & Joon. I thought it was cool but figured it was a reference to something. Never really thought to research it further.

name: mightymeliel
text: Benny & Joon not only references Buster Keaton and Charles Chaplin, there are also Harold Lloyd references and even a small nod to Singin' in the rain.

name: belgand
text: Harold Lloyd shot some mad erotic nude photographs. Even some in 3d. Dude was a straight player.

name: xiaomimi
text: If Buster did that gag the rolls would be streetcars, the forks would be the traffic infrastructure of Los Angeles, and someone would end up breaking a leg.

name: fattypneumonia
text: "Look, I'm Karl Malden.... now I'm Princess Leia - 'Luke! Luke! Use the force!"... I'm on a roll... now, LITERALLY, I'm on a roll..."

name: nice-on-water
text: Actually Chaplin stole that bit from someone else, apparently.  Some fat guy in a movie predating Gold Rush by a few years.  I SAW IT ON PBS IT MUST BE TRUE

name: shmuckeles
text: ray gets burned AGAIN. i love it when neph cold dishes it out

name: aaron_haynes
text:
I would probably be just as annoyed as Ray if I talked to a youngster who didn't know what Baba O'Riley was.

Significantly moreso if they said something like "Oh yeah, that song from CSI".

name: geysershitdick
text: Especially since the song from CSI is "Won't Get Fooled Again."

name: sandswipe
text:
Won't Get Fooled Again is the song from CSI: Miami.
Baba O'Riley is CSI: New York.
Who Are You is CSI: the other one.

They are all exactly the same so I can understand the confusion.

name: heccibiggs
text:
"The other one" is CSI: Crime Scene Investigation.

Which always struck me as the most stupid, redundant thing in the history of everything.

name: tekende
text: Forgetting Sarah Marshall has a running gag involving a primetime TV series called "Crime Scene: Scene of the Crime."

name: falseprophet
text:
That movie was pretty hilarious.

Maybe my dick realized that you're the devil!

...or something along those lines.

name: geysershitdick
text: are you fucking kidding me

name: canusdivinus
text: CSI loves them some Who.

name: capnroblivious
text: At a live trivia contest, Baba O'Riley was picked specifically for the dumb shits who were going to write down "Teenage Wasteland."  (That was a working title for the song.)

name: nice-on-water
text: Also title of a rejected song from the Lifehouse project.  Hardcore Wholigan and proud.

name: littlefatdog
text:
my dad used to say that shit every day as i left for school.. "dont take any wooden nickles"
also lil nef is a baller

name: tetrisattack
text: A comment left by tetrisattack was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by featurelessvoid, Moraiat, yingkaixing, stormagnet, Darthemed)

name: gormster
text: No, I think he doesn't understand that his friend's name is also the name of a Who song.

name: relaxing
text:
I think LN does understand, because he continues tossing out references to things he perceives to be "old fashioned."

And seriously, ain't no parent in this day got no kid named at all Baba O'Reilly.

name: slalvation
text: No, he doesn't. He was referencing that because of the "Who's on first?" joke, which he thought Ray was doing some nonsensical variation on, because he does not know about The Who.

name: relaxing
text:
The idea of the strip, as I understand it, is that LN is lying about where he will be when he goes out.

Would he really know about Abbott and Costello and Charlie Chaplain, but not The Who?

name: slalvation
text: A comment left by slalvation was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by goatmasterflash, NeoNaoNeo, trisha, stormagnet)

name: slab64
text: Wrong.

name: layzerblade
text:
What is key here is:

LN misunderstanding Ray =/= funny.

LN stone cold playing Ray by being much savvier than he is = funny.

name: semiquaver
text: Agreed.  S'okay, Slalvation is an asshole.

name: capnroblivious
text: This or ANY day.  There WAS no Baba O'Riley.  The name is taken from Townshend's guru, Meher Baba, and the minimalist composer who gave them the idea for the intro, Terry Reilly.

name: nice-on-water
text: THIS NEEDED TO BE SAID FERVENTLY

name: skoora
text: Little Nephew is so sassy. So sassy.

name: tttt
text:
when did Ray become so jive

he was always a little jive but this strip is just full on

name: clever-nickname
text:
next time I get two muffins, i'm doing that.

end of story.

name: laikalost
text:
I do this whenever I get the opportunity. None of my friends ever get the reference, be it Achewood or the original Chaplin performance.

Inside, it's a hollow victory.

name: farqussus
text: hang out at retirement homes

name: cousinted
text:
I don't need to fight
To prove I'm right
I don't need to be forgiven!

name: catgrl131
text:
I don't need to fight
To prove I'm right I don't need
To be forgiven

(Psst...See what I did there?)

name: dasilodavi
text: A comment left by dasilodavi was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by mikekitchell, EM2, chivalress, relaxing, thesyndicate88, stormagnet)

name: em2
text: Wicked sack can be hard to handle.

name: aelindil
text: He is a teenage wasteland.

name: cailetshadow
text: Little Neff lays down a smooth road of sass and then drives over it with the SASSMOBILE.

name: nonamejoe
text: Ray in the last panel senses a trap, but only after he's already put one foot in it.  Then he falls in all the way.

name: ssink
text: imagining ray playing with forks and muffins is the funniest thing to me in the world

name: stuart
text: Holla if you think LN calling Ray Abbot & Costello is because of his confusion with Who being a proper noun (Who's on first)

name: rowboat
text: Right here. I'm hollering.

name: slalvation
text: Was there any question?!

name: nonamejoe
text: That's the joke I read.

name: laikalost
text: Lil' Nephew's knowledge of classic pop culture is rather unsettling.

name: em2
text: Especially as he knows about old time film stars and wooden nickels, but not the Who. There is a strange gap here.

name: changuitotuerto
text: I just can't approve of this enough.

name: heccibiggs
text: This got a 5 for me for "Have fun being in or near the house." Hahahahaha I'm so saying that to my dad the next time I go out.

name: baryonyx
text: Nadsat comes to mind.

name: kickstart
text: How hilarious is "Have fun being in or near the house"?

name: cpnglxynchos
text: A: really hilarious.

name: farqussus
text: damnit, i said b: somewhat hilarious

name: dasilodavi
text: Seriously, I cannot tolerate Little Nephew.

name: schnappm
text: I figured you would've at least come to like him a little over the course of nine months

name: dasilodavi
text: Try reading his blog without wanting to eat a pile of glass.  I have a lot of love for most of the Achewood characters, but something about Little Nephew rubs me the wrong way something awful!

name: tekende
text: Yeah, I don't ever bother to read his blog. It takes more effort than a gladi8orrex post and isn't as worthwhile.

name: gigs
text: Oh christ, of course this strip comes up while I'm listening to Baba O'Riley. I know no one cares, but there's some kind of unspoken internet rule that you have to mention when something like this happens.

name: tothevictor10
text: this. is. the best strip. ever. almost. i think. it might be. lemme go read all the other ones.
